article.headline: Hofstra 64, Columbia 40
article.story: HEMPSTEAD, N.Y. (AP) -- Loren Stokes scored 23 points and Hofstra remained unbeaten with a 64-40 rout of Columbia on Wednesday night. The 8-0 record marks the Pride's best start in 32 years at the NCAA Division I level. Hofstra has not been 8-0 since the 1960-61 season when it won its first 10 games competing in the Small College Division. The school's best start on any level was 12-0 in 1954-55. Mike Radziejewski added 11 points for Hofstra. Matt Preston had nine points and 12 rebounds for Columbia (6-2), which had a three-game winning streak snapped and now trails 10-1 in the series. The 34 points were the least allowed by Hofstra since a 48-34 victory over Rider in 1988-89. Stokes had seven points and Aurimas Kieza hit two 3-pointers in a 16-3 run that gave the Pride a 38-21 halftime lead. Stokes had three baskets as Hofstra opened the second half with a 13-1 run that made it 51-22 with 13:40 to play. Columbia didn't have a field goal in the second half until a 3 by Jeremiah Boswell made it 51-26 with 11:27 left. The game was originally scheduled for Dec. 1, but was postponed when Columbia encountered travel difficulties.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
